diagram_descriptions: A collection of colorful tissue paper pom-poms in yellow, lime green, bright blue, teal, and hot pink.
A bouquet of paper flowers in shades of orange, peach, and pink, tied with a pink ribbon and a gift tag that says 'M' and 'Mother's Day'.
A close-up of a delicate paper flower made from book pages, with layered petals, resting on a wooden surface.

projects.name: Handmade Camellias Flower Bouquet
projects.finished_product_description: A bouquet of handmade camellia paper flowers presented in kraft wrapping paper, adorned with a ribbon and a decorative tag.

diagram_descriptions: A photograph shows a bouquet of handmade paper camellia flowers in various shades of pink, orange, and yellow, with green leaves. The bouquet is wrapped in brown kraft paper and tied with a light pink ribbon. A decorative tag with the letter 'M' and floral accents is attached to the ribbon.

A flat lay image displays the materials and tools needed for making the paper flowers. It includes a black piercing pad with labels for 'camellia flower die', 'piercing pad', 'wire stems', and 'stitchz by 8azzill'. Also visible are cut paper flower pieces in pink and white, a red ink pad, a makeup sponge, an embossing stylus, a paper piercer, and green wire stems.

tools.name: camellia flower dies
tools.purpose: tracing and cutting petal and leaf shapes

steps.instruction: Use the camellia flower dies to trace and cut the petal and leaf shapes from the cardstock.
Use the largest embossing stylus to firmly roll over each petal of the flower in a circular motion. This will distress the petal and cause each petal to slightly, curve inward.
steps.visual_description: A hand using a white embossing stylus to roll over a light pink paper petal, which is on a black cutting mat. Several other petals are visible.

steps.instruction: Repeat the second step with all parts of the flower, which should include two large petals, two small petals, and one center.
Gently dab the makeup sponge onto the inkpad, and then lightly brush the makeup sponge against the edge of each petal to add a bit of color. This adds dimension to the petal, making it more lifelike.
steps.visual_description: Several light pink paper petals, some with a pinkish hue on the edges, are arranged on a white surface. A pink ink pad and a makeup sponge are visible in the corner.

steps.instruction: Assemble the large petals, the smaller petals and roll the center as shown.
steps.visual_description: Three light pink paper petals are arranged on a white surface. One petal is fully formed into a flower shape, and two other large petals are positioned next to it.

projects.name: Paper Flower

steps.instruction: Pierce the center of the larger and smaller petals with the paper piercer.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a paper piercer tool, piercing the center of several pink paper petals arranged in a flower shape.

steps.instruction: Push the floral stem through the large petal.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a pink paper flower with a green floral stem being pushed through the center of the largest petal.

steps.instruction: Push the floral stem through the small petal.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a pink paper flower with a green floral stem being pushed through the center of a smaller petal.

steps.instruction: Coil the floral stem in the center as shown.
steps.visual_description: Close-up of the center of a pink paper flower, showing the green floral stem coiled around the center.

projects.finished_product_description: A pink paper flower with a coiled floral stem in the center.

diagram_descriptions: Image showing a hand using a paper piercer on pink paper petals.
Image showing a hand inserting a floral stem through the center of a pink paper flower's large petal.
Image showing a hand inserting a floral stem through the center of a pink paper flower's small petal.
Close-up image of the center of a pink paper flower with a coiled floral stem.

projects.name: Paper Flowers

steps.instruction: Squeeze a generous amount of hot glue onto the coiled floral stem center.
steps.visual_description: A pink paper flower with a coiled stem center, and a hot glue gun dispensing glue onto the center.

steps.instruction: Place the rolled flower center on top of the hot glue and press into place.
steps.visual_description: A pink paper flower being assembled, with the center being placed onto the glued stem.

steps.instruction: Squeeze tiny dots of black glitter glue into the center of your assembled bloom.
steps.visual_description: A pink paper flower with its center being decorated with small dots of black glitter glue from a dispenser.

steps.instruction: Once the flower is assembled, adhere the leaves to the underside of each flower.
steps.visual_description: A bouquet of three assembled paper flowers (one red, two pink) with green paper leaves adhered to the underside of each flower.

projects.finished_product_description: A bouquet of three paper flowers with leaves.

diagram_descriptions: A close-up of a pink paper flower with a hot glue gun applying glue to its center.
A pink paper flower with its center being placed onto the glued stem.
A pink paper flower with small dots of black glitter glue being applied to its center.
A bouquet of three assembled paper flowers (one red, two pink) with green paper leaves adhered to the underside of each flower.

projects.name: Paper Camellia Bouquet

steps.instruction: Create an assortment of paper camellia flowers and wrap a piece of wire around all the stems to form a bouquet.
steps.visual_description: A bouquet of colorful paper camellia flowers with their stems tied together with green twine.

steps.instruction: Wrap the bouquet in kraft paper to resemble a real bouquet from a flower market, along with optional ribbon and gift tag.
steps.visual_description: A bouquet of paper flowers wrapped in brown kraft paper, tied with a pink ribbon, and adorned with a gift tag that has the letter 'M' on it.

projects.finished_product_description: A paper flower bouquet wrapped in kraft paper, resembling a market bouquet, with optional ribbon and gift tag.

diagram_descriptions: A logo for ALLFREEPAPERCRATS with the tagline "Nothing Is A Waste Of Paper".
A title: "How to Make Paper Flowers: 8 Pretty Paper Flower Tutorials".
An image showing a close-up of the stems of a paper flower bouquet, tied together with green twine.
An image showing a completed paper flower bouquet wrapped in kraft paper, tied with a pink ribbon, and a gift tag with the letter 'M' on it.

A banner for FREEKIDSCRAFTS with the tagline "Explore. Imagine. Create.". It features several small images of crafts, including "Cheap & Easy Crafts for Kids", "9 Recycled Crafts", "Free Craft eNewsletter", "Paper Crafts", "Cheap & Easy", "Play & Pretend", and "Preschool Crafts". A red "View" tab is visible on the right side.

projects.name: Giant Crepe Paper Flowers Craft

materials.item: Floral tape or green washi tape

projects.finished_product_description: Giant crepe paper flowers that can be used as party decorations or photo props.

diagram_descriptions: A large pink crepe paper flower with an orange flower behind it, set against a tree trunk and grass.
A collection of craft supplies including two rolls of crepe paper (green and orange), a pair of pink scissors, a bottle of craft glue, floral tape, flower stamens, and green floral wires.

projects.name: Paper Flower

steps.instruction: Add a few stamens to the end of your wire and wrap it tightly with floral tape. This will be the center of your crepe paper flowers, and it also helps to hold the petals in place while you work, so that they don’t slip off the stem before the glue dries.
steps.visual_description: Close-up of a wire stem wrapped with floral tape, with yellow stamens attached to the top.

steps.instruction: Un-roll two folds of the crepe paper, so that you have a rectangular piece about 20 inches long x 4-5 inches wide. Fold it in half, lining up the short ends, then fold it in half two more times (for three times total). You are essentially folding it into a strip of eighths.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular piece of orange crepe paper is shown, then folded in half lengthwise, then folded in half again, and then folded in half a third time, resulting in a long, narrow strip.

steps.instruction: Cut a petal shape, and leave a strip of paper attached along one edge. Think of paper dolls for this step; you’ll be cutting four small petals, all attached by one strip of paper.
steps.visual_description: Three images showing the process of cutting petals from the folded crepe paper. The first shows two long, narrow strips of orange paper. The second shows a petal shape being cut from one of the strips, with a connecting strip along one edge. The third shows a hand holding a cut petal shape attached to a strip of paper.

steps.instruction: Wrap these four petals around the stamens of your flower, adding a few drops of glue at the base as you go.
steps.visual_description: A hand is shown wrapping an orange crepe paper petal around the stamens of a flower, with glue being applied at the base.

projects.finished_product_description: A paper flower with orange petals and yellow stamens.

diagram_descriptions: Image showing the stamens attached to a floral-taped wire stem.
A series of images demonstrating the folding and cutting of orange crepe paper to create flower petals.
A hand wrapping an orange crepe paper petal around the flower's center.

projects.name: Paper Flower

materials.item: floral tape or green washi tape

steps.instruction: Open the whole sheet of crepe paper and cut it lengthwise in half, creating two long strips about 7 feet long and 10 inches wide. Fold these long strips as you did earlier, folding five times, until you have sixteen layers of crepe.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a folded sheet of orange crepe paper.

steps.instruction: Cut a petal shape, leaving a strip of paper all connected at one end. Un-fold the paper, leaving you with a 7-foot length of petals all attached to one another.
steps.visual_description: Three images showing orange crepe paper cut into petal shapes, connected at one end.

steps.instruction: Wrap the connected strip around the base of your flower, adding drops of glue as you go. Next, with your second sheet of 7-foot crepe, fold it four times, creating a set of eight wider petals. Wrap and glue this final strip of petals onto the flower’s base.
steps.visual_description: Three images showing the process of wrapping and gluing orange crepe paper petals around the base of a flower stem.

steps.instruction: Then, cut a 20-inch square of green crepe, and fold it into quarters, then diagonally. At the center of the square, nip off a tiny corner to create a hole in the middle. At the opposite, outer edge, trim away paper creating a leaf shape.
steps.visual_description: Three images showing green crepe paper being folded, a corner being nipped off, and the paper being trimmed into a leaf shape.

steps.instruction: Un-fold the leaves, add them to the base of your flower (you can secure it with glue, if you like) and then use floral tape or green washi tape to wrap all the ends at the base of your flower, covering the brightly-colored crepe paper and securing it to the floral wire or washi tape.
steps.visual_description: Three images showing green crepe paper leaves being attached to the base of an orange paper flower and wrapped with floral tape.

projects.finished_product_description: A paper flower with brightly colored petals and green leaves.

steps.instruction: Finally, curve the petals by stretching each one slightly, and curling it outward. Do this for each petal, and you will find that it makes your crepe paper flowers look much more realistic, as though they really bloomed!
steps.visual_description: A hand is shown gently stretching and curling an orange crepe paper petal outwards.

diagram_descriptions: A close-up image shows a hand holding and shaping an orange crepe paper petal, demonstrating how to curve it outwards.
A young girl is holding two large, colorful paper flowers, one pink and one orange, outdoors.

projects.name: Romantic Book Page Rose

materials.item: Floral tape or green washi tape

steps.instruction: Start by adding glue to the floral wire.
Using small petals, begin building the center of the flower.
After several layers, continue only using the larger petals.
Finish by adding the scalloped pieces as leaves.

projects.finished_product_description: A DIY paper rose made from book pages.

diagram_descriptions: A close-up, overhead shot of a delicate, light-colored paper rose made from book pages, resting on a weathered wooden surface. The petals are layered and slightly curled, resembling a natural rose bloom. The texture of the paper and the wood grain are visible.

projects.name: Newspaper Flower Gift Topper

steps.instruction: Punch out two pieces of newspaper in each size punch.
Layer with the largest on the bottom to the smallest, alternating the scallops.
Staple the middle.
Scrunch up the layers individually, starting with the smallest.
Attach to your gift!

projects.finished_product_description: A gift topper made from scrunched newspaper layers resembling a flower.

diagram_descriptions: A close-up image of a finished newspaper flower gift topper, which is made of layered and scrunched newspaper circles, placed in a small brown cardboard box.

projects.name: Nifty Book Page & Tissue Paper Flowers

materials.item: Book pages or photocopies of book pages
Scissors or a round paper punch
Sticks (lollipop sticks, small dowels, skewers, floral wire, or anything else stick-like)

projects.finished_product_description: Whimsical, eclectic, and fun paper flowers made from book pages and tissue paper, with stems made from various stick-like materials.

diagram_descriptions: A bouquet of pink paper flowers with book page centers, arranged in a clear vase filled with clear decorative stones.
A close-up of craft supplies including a roll of white tape, scissors, and several pink paper flower petals cut into heart shapes from book pages.

projects.name: Paper Flower

tools.name: paper punch
tools.purpose: cutting circles and making center holes

steps.instruction: Cut out several circles. Use a paper punch or cut by hand. For each flower, use three to four circles of both book pages and tissue. Use a hole punch to make a hole in the centers of your circles.
steps.visual_description: A stack of pink and text-covered paper circles with a hole in the center.

steps.instruction: Start with either color circle, but book pages in the center work best. Take your circle, put the stick through the hole in the center, and wrap it around. When arranged as desired, use a small piece of masking tape or floral tape to hold it in place.
steps.visual_description: A paper circle wrapped around a stick, with the text side visible, secured with tape.

steps.instruction: Alternate colors of paper circles. Mix in more or less color from the tissue as desired. For each circle added, curl it up slightly less, and tape it to the stick to secure it as you work.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a stick with a partially formed paper flower, showing layers of pink and text-covered paper circles being added and curled.

tips: Use screw punch for clean holes
projects.finished_product_description: A paper flower made from layered, curled paper circles attached to a stick.

diagram_descriptions: Image showing a stack of pink and text-covered paper circles with a hole in the center, ready for assembly.
Image showing a single paper circle wrapped around a stick, with the text side visible, secured with tape.
Image showing a hand holding a stick with a partially formed paper flower, demonstrating the layering and curling of paper circles.
A close-up image of a paper flower being made, showing the rolled paper petals taped to a stem at the bottom.

A graphic promoting a free ebook titled "Easy Garden Projects" from FaveCrafts, featuring various garden-related craft ideas like decorative stakes, garden decorations, watering cans, and flower pot projects. It also advertises a free craft e-newsletter.

A graphic promoting a free ebook titled "25 Cool Things to Do with Wine Bottles" from FaveCrafts, showcasing projects related to wine bottles, corks, and accessories. It also advertises a free craft e-newsletter.

projects.name: Dainty Little Tissue Paper Flowers

steps.instruction: Cut three different sized strips of tissue paper. Fold into squares.
Layer the strips from largest to smallest.
Put pin through the middle.
Use floral tape to secure the pin to the wire if you want a longer stem, or just to cover the pin itself.
Trim each layer of tissue paper into circles.
Crinkle up each layer to create your flower.

projects.finished_product_description: A dainty tissue paper flower with multiple layers of petals.

diagram_descriptions: A close-up, overhead view of a finished Dainty Little Tissue Paper Flower. The flower has multiple layers of petals in orange, white, and pink. A pink pearl bead is in the center. The flower is resting on a wooden surface.

projects.name: Simple Spring Tissue Paper Flowers

materials.item: Large flower or scallop paper punch

projects.finished_product_description: Gorgeous paper flowers made from tissue paper, suitable for spring celebrations, decorations, or as a gift for Mother's Day.

diagram_descriptions: A top-down view of seven colorful tissue paper flowers arranged in a cluster. The flowers are in shades of blue, yellow, green, and pink, with a light blue flower in the center. The flowers have a fluffy, layered appearance.
A close-up image showing a white scallop-edged paper punch placed on top of a folded sheet of light blue tissue paper.

projects.name: Paper Flower

steps.instruction: Fold one piece of tissue paper in half, then in half again two more times so that you end up with eight thicknesses of paper.
Along the folded edge, slide the paper into your punch all the way back and press down firmly to cut out some flower shapes.
steps.visual_description: A stack of folded teal tissue paper with a scalloped edge, next to a scalloped circle punch.

steps.instruction: With all eight tissue flower shapes in a neat pile, staple them together a couple of times in the center.
steps.visual_description: A stack of eight teal tissue paper flower shapes, stapled in the center.

steps.instruction: Scrunch each layer of tissue from the center out to create a ruffled flower.
steps.visual_description: A hand gently scrunching the layers of a teal tissue paper flower from the center outwards.

projects.finished_product_description: A ruffled paper flower made from layered, scrunched tissue paper.

projects.name: Pretty in Pink Tissue Paper Flowers

materials.item: Tissue paper, light and dark pink

projects.finished_product_description: A paper flower made from tissue paper in two shades of pink, planted in a decorative pot with pebbles, and set as a centerpiece.

diagram_descriptions: A close-up, overhead view of a pink tissue paper flower in a grey pot. The flower has multiple layers of petals in light and dark pink. A pink ribbon is tied in a bow around the base of the flower stem. The pot is filled with dark grey decorative glass sand and some green floral moss.

projects.name: Paper Flower Center

steps.instruction: Cut two circles from the dark pink tissue paper.
steps.visual_description: Two dark pink circles, one slightly larger than the other, are shown. The number '1' is in the bottom right corner of the image.

steps.instruction: Crumple up the one circle and put it on top of the second circle.
steps.visual_description: One dark pink tissue paper circle is crumpled and placed on top of another, slightly larger, flat dark pink tissue paper circle. The number '2' is in the bottom right corner of the image.

steps.instruction: Fold the second circle over the crumpled-up one.
steps.visual_description: A skewer is shown with the crumpled tissue paper from step 2 attached to its tip. The second, larger circle is folded over the crumpled paper, enclosing it around the skewer tip. The number '3' is in the bottom right corner of the image.

steps.instruction: Add to the skewer and secure with floral tape.
steps.visual_description: A hand is holding a skewer with the formed paper flower center attached to the tip. Floral tape is wrapped around the base of the paper center and the skewer. The number '4' is in the bottom right corner of the image.

projects.finished_product_description: The center of a paper flower, attached to a skewer and secured with floral tape.

projects.name: Paper Flower Rose

steps.instruction: Trace and cut 16 hearts from the light pink tissue paper. These will be the rose petals.
steps.visual_description: Image 1 shows a hand holding a skewer with a small, tightly rolled pink bud at the tip, with two light pink heart shapes partially unfurled around it. The text 'Making the flower' is overlaid on the image. A number '1' is in the bottom right corner of the image.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom part of each petal around the skewer, and secure the bottom point of each heart to the skewer, using the floral tape.
steps.visual_description: Image 2 shows a hand holding a skewer with a small pink bud. Two light pink heart-shaped petals are folded around the bud and secured at the base with floral tape. A number '2' is in the bottom right corner of the image.

steps.instruction: Continue until all the rose petals have been secured.
steps.visual_description: Image 3 shows a partially formed light pink rose on a skewer. Several heart-shaped petals are attached and folded around the center bud. A number '3' is in the bottom right corner of the image.

steps.instruction: Now, trace and cut 12 hearts from the dark pink tissue paper, and secure these with the floral tape to the skewer. The dark petals will form the outer edge of the rose.
steps.visual_description: Image 4 shows a nearly completed paper rose. The outer petals are made of dark pink tissue paper, layered around the lighter pink inner petals. A number '4' is in the bottom right corner of the image.

projects.finished_product_description: A rose made from layered tissue paper petals.

projects.name: Paper Rose in a Pot

steps.instruction: Gently fold the petals of the rose open.
steps.visual_description: A hand gently folding the petals of a paper rose.

steps.instruction: Cut the skewer shorter so that it will be in proportion to the size of the pot.
Cover the whole skewer with floral tape, so that the rose will have a green stem.
steps.visual_description: A hand wrapping floral tape around a skewer to create a green stem.

steps.instruction: Add the green rose leaves to the bottom of the rose.
steps.visual_description: Three green paper rose leaves attached to the bottom of a paper rose stem.

final_touches.instruction: Spray the whole pot with the silver spray paint. First spray the outside and allow to dry thoroughly, spraying the pot for a second time, if necessary, to obtain a nice even look.
Turn the pot around and spray the inside of the pot, and allow to dry thoroughly.
Add a small piece of dry floral foam to the inside of the pot.
Gently push the stem of the rose into the foam.
Tie the ribbon around the stem of the rose, make a bow and cut the ends shorter to produce a neat result.
final_touches.details: make a bow and cut the ends shorter

final_touches.instruction: Add some moss and decorative glass sand to cover the floral foam.

diagram_descriptions: A hand holding a green skewer wrapped in floral tape.
Three green paper rose leaves attached to the bottom of a paper rose stem.
Image of a large pink paper flower with an orange paper flower behind it.
Image of a delicate paper flower made from book pages.
Image of several small, colorful pom-pom style paper flowers in yellow, green, blue, and pink.
